word.wordExample: W1
The panda has got a white head but black legs.
Mary has got long brown hair.
I have got thirty-two teeth in my mouth.
Tech has got long arms but short legs.
- What have you got in your hands? - Cherries!
I have got ten fingers on my hands.
Cats have got four legs.
The red shoes are too small for my feet.
I have got ten toes on my feet.

generalWord.generalWordExample: Let's create a story with kings and queens.
Messi is a very good football player.
My sister is like my mother, with black hair and green eyes.
Mr Gardner has got sheep on his farm. He has also got horses.
Your jeans are very trendy.
I have got a tablet but I haven’t got a laptop.
Have we got any apples?
My doll has got long blonde hair.

phrase.phraseExample: You are a very good student. Well done!
Level 1 complete! Let’s go to Level 2!

word.wordExample: W1
My toys are in my bedroom.
There is a toilet in the bathroom.
We cook in the kitchen.
There is a big TV in the living room.
In the summer, we sit on the balcony.
My house has got a garden with flowers and trees.
Dad's car is in the garage.

generalWord.generalWordExample: I have got an English project for school.
Pizza is my favourite food.
Santorini is a beautiful place.
There are six rooms in my house.
My parents’ names are Olivia and Harry.
Basketball players are very tall.
Grandma's house is old. It isn't modern.
I like your T-shirt! It’s nice! / Miss White is a very nice teacher!
Anna has got beautiful big blue eyes.
Tulips are my favourite flowers.
My bed is very comfortable.

phrase.phraseExample: Monopoly is a great game. I like it!

word.wordExample: W1
There is a big comfortable sofa in the living room.
I have got a lamp on my desk.
There are some bananas on the kitchen table.
Sit on this chair, please.
Those books in the bookcase are Jason’s.
My bookcase has got seven shelves.
My sister has got five dresses in her wardrobe.

generalWord.generalWordExample: Let's find the answer to this question.
There is a map of London in my geography book.
New York is in the USA.
- Let’s go to the park! - That’s a great idea! / - There is chocolate cake in the kitchen. - Great! Let’s eat it!
My brother isn’t here now. He’s at the cinema.
I like my burger with ketchup.
This is not a real dog. It’s a toy.
I like your bike. It’s cool!
My skateboard is fantastic!

phrase.phraseExample: Good morning, children! Let’s start the lesson.
- Where is my school bag, Mum? - It’s on your bed!
We are first! We did it!

word.wordExample: W1

In the PE lesson we do sports.
I like maths because I am very good with numbers.
I read history books about Rome.
Nancy has got a geography project about Asia.
Our science lesson today is about the sun.

generalWord.generalWordExample: Are your parents back from work?
Mario is new at this school.
Emily is a very smart girl and she is beautiful, too.
Fabio loves spaghetti because he’s from Italy.
There are twenty students in my class this year.
A year has got four seasons and twelve months.
English is a very interesting subject. I like it!
I find this puzzle very easy. Let's do it!
I play basketball because it’s fun!
Let's find Greece on the map.

phrase.phraseExample: I don't know this boy. What's his name?
Come on, children! Let’s go to the park and play!
- Hello! My name is Nick! - Nice to meet you!

word.wordExample: W1
There are twenty-five desks in my classroom.
The school library has got interesting books.
- Where is the PE teacher? - He's in the gym.

Let’s have some lemonade at the school canteen.
The teachers’ toilets are next to the teachers’ room.
The children aren't in the classroom now. They're in the playground.

I like the food in that restaurant.
This is a very tasty burger.

phrase.phraseExample: - Where is the bathroom, please? – It’s the second door on your left.

Lucy’s rubber is next to her pencil.
Colour the sun with a yellow marker, children!
There are pencils, pens and a rubber in my pencil case.
I haven’t got a pencil sharpener because I write with a pen.

generalWord.generalWordExample: My dad reads sports articles every day.

I play the flute and the violin.

- Where is Ethiopia? - It's in Africa.

phrase.phraseExample: This is an article about school bags around the world.

generalWord.generalWordExample: My birthday is a special day.
You swim very fast! You’ve got a special talent.
There are some new students in my class this year. / Let’s play some music!

Mr Scott is in a wheelchair because he can’t walk.
I walk to school every day.
Beyonce is a fantastic singer.
My grandma is old and can’t hear very well.

phrase.phraseExample: This new film is great! Don’t you agree?

At weekends we have breakfast/lunch/dinner at grandma’s house.
My sister often does her homework in the library.
I usually go to bed late in the evening.

generalWord.generalWordExample: My parents are often very busy in the morning.
My friend Betty is a very nice girl.

There is a beautiful park near our house.

I tidy my bedroom every afternoon.

phrase.phraseExample: Thanks for the beautiful flowers!
We have breakfast at 8 o’ clock every day.
Time for bed kids! It’s very late!

Write back soon! Bye for now!

Karate is a sport from Japan.

phrase.phraseExample: Have fun at the party, children!

phrase.phraseEnglish: - Thank you very much! - You’re welcome!
phrase.phraseExample: - Thank you very much for your help! - You’re welcome!

word.wordExample: W1
It’s ten past seven.
It’s ten to seven.
It’s a quarter past seven.
It’s a quarter to seven.
It’s half past seven.

generalWord.generalWordExample: Zebras run fast and sometimes escape from lions.
- Where are my car keys, dear? - I think they’re on the table.

My clock says it’s 9 o’clock.
Taboo is my favourite board game.

phrase.phraseExample: You’re always late! Hurry up, please!

These photos are great! Good job!

Let’s sit on the sofa and watch TV.

I like doing puzzles with my little sister.

generalWord.generalWordExample: - I can’t ride my bike very well, Dad! - We can try together! / This food is very tasty! Let’s try it!

The word ‘family’ has got six letters.
When I don’t know the correct answer I often guess it.
The baby sometimes cries at night because she’s hungry.
Are these tears? Why are you crying?

- Why are you screaming? - There is a mouse under my bed!

My uncle always tells jokes. He is very funny!

When I want to watch a film or do a school project, I use my laptop.

generalWord.generalWordExample: My brother thinks that cartoons are only for kids.

Look at the stars in the sky! They’re beautiful!

I can’t walk in these boots. They’re not comfortable.

I’m really tired. Let’s go home, please!

OK! That’s it! I’m telling Mum that you aren’t doing your homework!

word.wordExample: W1

In most schools in Greece, pupils don’t wear uniforms.

generalWord.generalWordExample: St Patrick’s Day is on 17th March.
Let’s make a special dinner to celebrate Father’s Day this Sunday.
My cousin is working in Dublin, Ireland, at the moment. Bono is a famous Irish singer.
I can remember all the places we visited on our last trip to Italy.
Eva is decorating her new house. She is also changing the colour of the walls.
The shamrock has got three green leaves.
Plus (+) and minus (–) are maths symbols.
You can find a lot of clothes shops in Oxford Street.
The cinema was full of children last night because Frozen was on.
All the girls are dressed in nice clothes for the school dance.
He likes drinking cold water even in winter.
My Irish grandfather can play the bagpipes.
Do you want to taste my banana cake?
Ruth is making soup with vegetables and beef right now.

phrase.phraseExample: - Can I call my brother from your mobile phone? - Of course you can.
Ted can’t wait to meet his friends tonight.

word.wordExample: W1
It’s sunny today, so let’s play in the playground.
Mum is going to the theatre this Saturday to watch her favourite show, Cats.
That theme park has got some great rides. Let’s try them all!
Uncle Kevin often goes to the stadium to watch his favourite football team.
It’s really hot, Dad! Can we go to a water park to swim and have fun?

generalWord.generalWordExample: Lisa and Betty have got a school project next week, so they must study at the weekend.
On our last trip to London, we visited many famous sights, like the London Eye and Big Ben.
Pam’s favourite play is Romeo and Juliet.
- Why don’t we play a board game? - That sounds great! / - What’s that sound? - It’s our neighbours’ new car.
Yesterday we watched the musical Mamma Mia.
Ben Affleck is a famous actor. He played Batman in the 2016 film.
This building is huge! It’s got 60 floors.
You mustn’t talk on the phone when you drive. It’s dangerous.
I can’t try this ride. I’m scared!
George watched his favourite band live in the park yesterday.
Philip is singing very loudly and I can’t sleep.

phrase.phraseExample: The actors in The Lion King are all dressed like animals.
It was very hot yesterday, so we stayed at the beach all day long.
Messi takes the ball and he scores a goal!

word.wordExample: W1
Rob plays the drums in our school band.
My sister plays the trumpet. She’s a great musician.
Mozart knew how to play the violin when he was only five years old.
I can play the piano and my brother can play the guitar.
- Do you like jazz music? - Yes, I do. I love the sound of the saxophone.

generalWord.generalWordExample: Match the answers to these questions. / These socks don’t match. One is yellow and the other is brown.
I think that the correct answer is B.
Which part of the film did you like, Helen?
When we were kids, our grandma read us stories in the evening.
In some places, people used donkeys to travel from place to place because they didn’t have cars.
My grandma gets up in the morning when she hears the rooster.
The train leaves at 6 o’clock. Hurry up! / Can you leave some cake for me, please?
Mary didn’t have time to cook so she decided to order a sandwich for lunch.
I don’t feel very well today so I’m not going to work.
Last night, a thief took my bag and my mobile phone.
Why are you wearing that mask? You scared me!
Mike enjoys jumping up and down on his bed.

phrase.phraseExample: In the story, The Musicians of Bremen, a donkey, a dog, a cat and a rooster decide to leave their farms.
Once upon a time, there was a cat with black boots.
I met my friend Peter on the way to work yesterday.

phrase.phraseGreek: κι έζησαν αυτοί καλά κι εμείς καλύτερα
phrase.phraseExample: In the end, the wolf never came back and they lived happily ever after.

word.wordExample: W1
This stadium is really big! It’s got 30,000 seats.
Did you buy tickets for the football match last week?
Sam and Kelly love eating popcorn when they watch their favourite films.
Who was the actor in the film Spiderman? / My sister is an actress and she is working at a theatre in London now.
My favourite character in this book is Tech.

generalWord.generalWordExample: My baby brother loves watching animated films.
You’ve got an amazing voice. You can be a singer one day.
Aunt Lisa likes reading magazines about celebrities.
- How much time do we need to make the cake? - About thirty minutes.
This food is so tasty! I would like the recipe, please. / I’m taking a test tomorrow so I must study today.
Wonder Woman is my favourite comic hero.
The first group of students is the Red Team and the second group is the Blue Team.
The taxi is arriving at our house in five minutes.
I can’t study when the music is so loud! Please turn off the radio.

phrase.phraseExample: Hello, Martha! It’s me again!
Aunt Kelly looks like my grandma.
- My cousin Derek visited 11 countries last year. - Really?
It takes about twelve years to complete school in my country.
Ben works really hard and this is why he hasn’t got much free time.

word.wordExample: W1
Do you know anything about Picasso, the famous Spanish painter?
Hans Christian Andersen was a great writer of children’s stories.
In a musical, there are usually actors, singers and dancers.
Graffiti artists decorate the buildings of the city with their paintings.

generalWord.generalWordExample: - What kind of music do you like? - Hip hop.
We visited a museum of modern art last week.
Do you know any fun facts about animals? / It is a fact that cats can see very well at night.
We visit the UK every year because my father comes from Liverpool.
Lucy painted a beautiful picture for Grandma. / Let’s paint our bedroom green and yellow.
Ron is really good at playing the piano. He can become a musician.
When you mime, you play a character or you tell a story without words.
The famous painter, Salvador Dali, had a very long moustache.
I’ve got a problem. Please come here quickly!
A famous sight in Denmark is The Little Mermaid in Copenhagen.
The Millers can’t wait for the birth of their first child.
Maggy acted in a lot of plays when she was at school.

phrase.phraseExample: Albert Einstein was born in Germany in 1879.
Daisy is very smart and she’s really good at maths and science.
My favourite story is Christian Andersen’s The Ugly Duckling.
The Little Mermaid is an old story and it’s also a great animated film.

word.wordExample: W1
Rabbits have got long ears and small eyes.
Our neighbour’s dog, Ruby, has got six small puppies.
Yesterday, I found a beautiful kitten in front of my house and I gave it some milk.
Hamsters look like mice but they are friendlier than them.
The cat is looking at the goldfish because she’s hungry.
Henry's parrot is colourful and he can also talk! He can say "Hello!"
Turtles live for many years. They can swim very well.

generalWord.generalWordExample: - Do you have a pet? - No, but I would like to adopt a puppy.
What kind of pets do you prefer? Dogs or cats?
Our dog Bruno is really playful! He always jumps up and down and plays with his toys.
I live in a noisy neighbourhood and I can’t sleep well at night.
Please be quiet because my brother is doing his homework.
I washed my car yesterday so it is clean now. / Mary always helps her mother clean the house.
- PE is easier than science. - Yes, I agree with you!
Be careful! Don’t break the eggs! / I need a break because I’m very tired right now.
Our house is very small. We need a bigger space to have a party.
- Can you tell me what to do? - I’m a bit confused.

phrase.phraseExample: There’s an animal shelter in our city that helps cats and dogs.
- I think that dogs are great friends for people. - That’s true.

word.wordExample: W1
Please don’t go skiing on that mountain, Paul. It’s dangerous.
The Nile is the longest river in the world.
Let’s visit the pyramids in the Sahara Desert!
Great Britain is the biggest island in Europe.
Peter enjoys swimming the sea every summer.
Foxes and wolves live in the forest.
Loch Ness is a famous lake in Scotland.

generalWord.generalWordExample: The Empire State Building is very high. It’s got 102 floors.
Japan is a country in Asia.
Monkeys climb trees to get bananas.
My friend Abeba comes from Africa. She lives in Ethiopia.
We must go through the forest to arrive at Grandma’s house.
This documentary is about the life of the giraffe.
Elephants only eat plants. / Mum planted some flowers in our garden yesterday.
Crocodiles live in rivers and lakes and eat other animals.
We are a very large family. I’ve got three sisters and two brothers.
The desert is a very dry place because it doesn’t rain very often there.
Camels live in the desert and they don’t drink much water.
I would like a burger without lettuce, please.

phrase.phraseExample: You can find R. Wadlow in the Guiness Book of World Records because he was the tallest man in history.
Mount Everest is the highest mountain in the world.
My cat is in that tree! How did she climb up there?

word.wordExample: W1
Hippos can sleep under the water.
Zebras look like horses but they’re black and white.
The African elephant is bigger than the Asian elephant.
In many stories, the lion is the king of all the animals.
Giraffes have got long legs but their ears are small.
Tigers look like cats but they are large and dangerous animals.
Yesterday, I saw a snake in the forest and I was very scared.

generalWord.generalWordExample: Oh no, I can’t see clearly! It’s very foggy!
Let’s do our homework quickly so we can go out and play.
Let’s sit on the grass and have a picnic.
Uncle Kevin likes riding his horse on his farm.
There are stars and stripes on the American flag.
In winter, there aren’t any leaves on these trees.
I like the way you dance! It’s cool!
Can you show me how to make this cake?
I’ve got something important to tell you.
Drive more slowly because a lot of kids play in this street.

phrase.phraseExample: On our holidays in Africa, we went on a safari.
My mother works eight hours a day.
- Where can I put this glass? - Over there on the table, please.

word.wordExample: W1
Most people in large cities use the underground because it is the fastest means of transport.
Next month, I’m travelling to the USA by plane.
I always travel by ship in summer because I love the sea.
Helicopters are smaller and travel more slowly than planes.
Why don’t we go to the park to ride our bicycles/bikes?
John's afraid to ride a motorbike because he can’t even ride a bike.

generalWord.generalWordExample: Future cars will fly. / In the future, robots will help us tidy the house.
Leonardo da Vinci was a great painter and he was a scientist, too.
It is not safe for children to play out in the street.
Can you take me to school today? I’m tired, I can’t walk.
I looked everywhere but my keys were lost.
The bus driver always says "Good morning!" to us.
A backpack is more practical than a suitcase when you go walking in the mountains.
Everybody thinks that tomatoes are vegetables but they’re actually fruit.
People first travelled into space in 1961. / I would like to make a space trip around the Earth one day.
The Earth circles the sun in 365 days.
This house has got an amazing view of the sea.
I’m sure he’ll come back soon. He’s never late.

phrase.phraseExample: A hippo can’t run as fast as a zebra.
Dad bought a new car yesterday. Let’s go for a ride!

word.wordExample: W1
My grandma didn’t feel well so we took her to hospital.
Let’s go training at the new sports centre in our neighbourhood.
This bank is open from 8.00 to 2.00 every day.
My grandparents go to church every Sunday.
They found the thief and took him to the police station last night.
I must go to the post office because I want to send this letter to my friend in Mexico.

generalWord.generalWordExample: The new mayor, Mr Stevenson, is going to help the animal shelters of our city.
Justin asked his mum to make a cake for his birthday party. / You can always ask when you don’t know something.
The topic of this article is technology.
Dad is building a dog house for little Roxy.
The ice cream at that shop usually costs £3 but today, it’s free!
Tina didn’t come to work today because she felt a bit sick.
There are brown and white ducks swimming on that lake.
It’s sunny! Let’s go outside and play.
Tourists in London usually visit Big Ben, the London Eye and the British Museum.
My friends and I are organising a trip to Manchester next weekend.
Fay collects boxes and bottles for recycling.
I have usually got three items in my bag, my mobile phone, my wallet and my keys.
I would like to inform you that you mustn’t take pictures in the museum.

phrase.phraseExample: There are a lot of shops and restaurants in the city centre.
Jim studies very hard because this way, he will get an ‘A’ in the test.

word.wordExample: W1
Ryan is a doctor and he works in that big hospital.
There was a problem with our car so my dad called a mechanic.
Edward is a pilot so he travels to a lot of different places in the world.
Astronauts travel into space to explore it.
The chef at that restaurant is great! His food is delicious.
My cousin Virginia trains every day because she is an athlete.
Grandpa is a farmer and he has got a lot of sheep and horses on his farm.
My cat was sick so I took her to the vet yesterday.
Erin asked the shop assistant to bring her a different dress.
Police officers in London usually ride bikes or horses.

generalWord.generalWordExample: This car is large so it’s ideal for a big family.
To learn more about us, visit our website: www.cityofflowers.com.
I love documentaries about space and planets.
I can’t solve this exercise! It’s really difficult!
My cousin is very smart. He can solve puzzles very easily.
Kim loves travelling and exploring different countries.
Ben asked the mechanic to fix his motorbike.
What would you like to be when you grow up?

phrase.phraseExample: Derek is an athlete and he’s training for the next Olympic Games in Tokyo.
